business.headline: Fewer slabs, simpler rules? Next GST Council meet may trigger overhaulThe upcoming GST Council meeting, likely to be held in August 2025 after the monsoon session of Parliament, could bring key reforms in the way GST is structured and collected.

Housing sales slide 14% as affordability pressures mount across cities: ReportThe PropTiger report, which tracks sales and launches across major cities, found that the most significant annual drop was recorded in Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR) and Pune, where sales fell by 32% and 27% respectively.

Why this IITian took up a guard's job to build Mygate, valued at Rs 1,600 croreMyGate has raised a total of $83.3 million across eight rounds. Its latest funding was in April 2023, a Series B round worth $3.29 million, putting its valuation at Rs 1,670 crore, according to Tracxn.

Tesla is finally in India. But can it go the distance?Tesla's India debut is a big milestone, but long-term success will depend on how well the company adapts to India's unique mix of pricing realities, policy expectations, and market dynamics.

Are private school fees draining India's middle class? CA shares eye-opening figuresWith fees climbing each year, parents are feeling the pinch more than ever. Maybe now is the right moment to pause, think, and ask ourselves, are we getting real value for this cost? Can we secure our kids' future without spending a fortune on fees? asks a Delhi-based CA.

SSY scheme: How your daughter can get Rs 71 lakh at 21It is a small savings scheme backed by the government, which offers high interest rates, tax benefits under Section 80C, and tax-free returns on maturity. Over 4.1 crore accounts have been opened so far under this scheme.

Good news soon for HDFC Bank shareholders? Here's all you need to knowHDFC Bank shares have delivered a 24% gain over the past year, with a year-to-date rise of nearly 13%. The stock has climbed more than 21% over the last six months, posting gains of 7% over the past three months and 4% in the previous month.

Did Ashok Leyland shares fall over 50% today? Details hereThe steep drop is the result of the company's 1:1 bonus issue, which came into effect on Wednesday. When a stock goes "ex-bonus," its price adjusts to reflect the additional shares being issued.
Sensex opens 69 points lower, Nifty below 25,200; HDFC Bank up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 197.64 points to 82,373.27, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 61.80 points to 25,134.00 as of 9:28 am.

Anthem Biosciences IPO to close for bidding: Check latest subscription, GMPThis IPO is entirely an offer for sale (OFS) of 5.96 crore equity shares by existing shareholders. The company itself will not receive any money from this offer. The price band has been set at Rs 570 per share.

Big GST changes ahead? Centre signals green light, says reportThe Prime Minister's Office (PMO) has given an in-principle nod to a revamp of the GST structure, paving the way for possible reforms in the upcoming GST Council meeting scheduled for August.

The Theobroma story: How 2 sisters turned a cafe into 225-store pan-India chainPrivate equity firm ChrysCapital has struck a sweet deal to acquire a 90% stake in Theobroma Foods for Rs 2,410 crore. The bakery chain, started by two sisters in Mumbai, has grown into a 225-store brand loved for its brownies and cakes. Read on to know more about the Mumbai-based bakery chain.

MTNL misses Rs 8,585 crore payments, owes 7 public sector banksIn a filing on Tuesday, MTNL confirmed that it has defaulted on both principal and interest payments to a group of lenders, which include some of India's biggest state-owned banks.
Sensex ends 317 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; HCLTech down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 317.45 points to end at 82,570.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 113.50 points to close at 25,195.80.

Anthem Biosciences IPO fully booked: Should you subscribe? Check listing gainsThe IPO opened for subscription on July 14, aims to raise Rs 3,395 crore through a complete offer for sale (OFS) of 5.96 crore equity shares.

Why Rs 12 crore didn't make this man happy? Investment advisor explainsWhile money matters, it should never cost you your health, peace of mind, or precious family time. True wealth is living well, not just stacking numbers in a bank account, says an investment advisor.

Why Zerodha's Nithin Kamath wants short selling made easy in IndiaIf someone wants to short a stock today, they mostly do it through futures or options. But there's a catch, there are only 224 stocks in India that have futures and options. So if a bad company is not on that list, no one can short it easily.

Theobroma to be sold, Rs 2,410-crore sweet deal baked by ChrysCapital: ReportFounded in 2004 by sisters Kainaz Messman Harchandrai and Tina Messman Wykes, Theobroma began with a single outlet at Cusrow Baug on Mumbai's Colaba Causeway.

Claiming fake ITR refunds? Here's what could happenTo give honest taxpayers a chance to fix their mistakes, the department had earlier asked people to revise their returns if they had claimed any wrong deductions.

Filing ITR-2 or ITR-3? Check these common mistakes and tips to avoid themUsing the Excel utility for ITR-2 or ITR-3 seems easy, but it's easy to get stuck if you're not careful. One wrong entry can throw your entire tax calculation off. Here's a handy guide to avoid common slip-ups.

Explained: Why HCLTech shares are down 4% todayOver the past few days, HCLTech has been under pressure. The stock has declined 7.9% in the last five trading sessions, 9.58% in the past month, and over 14.6% in the past six months.

Tesla showroom now in Mumbai. Price list of Model Y EVs in India revealed Live UpdatesThe Mumbai showroom will serve as Tesla's main display and customer experience centre, offering visitors a chance to view the vehicles up close and understand Tesla's technology.
Sensex opens 119 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Tata Motors up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 176.33 points to 82,429.79, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.50 points to 25,145.80 as of 9:29 am.

Tesla's Model Y to debut in India at Rs 60 lakhIn comparison, the Model Y starts at $44,990 in the United States, 263,500 yuan in China, and 45,970 euros in Germany. This makes the Indian version one of the most expensive, mainly due to import duties and logistics costs.

Sensex, Nifty today: Inflation drops, but will stock markets rise?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,166 points around 8:22 am, suggesting a possible higher start for Nifty50, which closed at 25,082.3 on Monday. This points to cautious optimism on Dalal Street after four straight sessions of losses.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces IPO allotment: Online guide to see status. Check GMPInvestors who applied for the IPO can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (also known as Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).

Bitcoin hits record $123,000 as US policy hopes boost crypto marketBitcoin is up about 30% so far this year and its rise has lifted other coins too. Ether, the second-biggest token, climbed to a five-month high of $3,059. XRP and Solana also rose about 3% each.

Retail inflation cools to 6-year low of 2.10% in JuneThis is the fifth month in a row that inflation has remained below the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) medium-term target of 4%, and the eighth consecutive month it has stayed under the central bank's upper limit of 6%
Sensex closes 247 points lower, Nifty below 25,100; Eternal up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 247.01 points to close at 82,253.46, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 67.55 points to end at 25,082.30.

Trap, click, renew: How OTT apps make it hard to cancel subscriptionsAccording to data collected by community platform LocalCircles, 50% of respondents said they have frequently had difficulty cancelling subscriptions to digital services.

Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta on why your portfolio should be yours, not someone else'sBuilding your investment portfolio should match your own risk comfort, timeframe and goals. What works for your friend may not work for you, says MD and CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, Radhika Gupta.

Why your tax refund may be delayed this yearOne big reason for the delay is that the tax filing season began late this year. Normally, people can file their returns from April onwards. But this time, the Income Tax Department released the ITR utilities quite late.
Sensex down 400 points: Why is stock market falling todayAs of 11:50 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down by 388.85 points to 82,111.62, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 110.85 points to 25,039.00.

Only 6.7% filed ITRs: CoinSwitch co-founder on why Indians delay tax filingIndia has made big progress in digital tax filing over the years. There are new portals, better forms and more ways to pay taxes online. Yet, millions still wait till the last few days to get their documents in order.

Explained: Why Ola Electric shares gained 5% todayOla Electric share price: The stock touched an intraday high of Rs 43.60 before trading 5.45% higher at Rs 41.99 around 11:11 am, shortly after the electric two-wheeler maker announced its financial results for the first quarter of FY26.

Bitcoin zooms past $120,000 to reach all-time high. Here's whyThe world's largest cryptocurrency was last seen trading at $120,700.54, up 1.32%, as investor confidence remained strong ahead of important regulatory discussions in the United States.
Sensex, Nifty start week in red as IT stocks drag markets lower againThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 266.34 points to 82,234.13, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 67.95 points to 25,081.90 as of 9:22 am.

Travel Food Services to make market debut today; here's the latest GMPTravel Food Services listing: The grey market premium (GMP), which had dropped sharply in the past week, has seen a slight rise ahead of the listing.

Jane Street deposits Rs 4,843.5 crore, set to return to Dalal Street: ReportIn its interim order, Sebi had accused Jane Street of using manipulative strategies in Indian stock markets. The regulator directed the firm to deposit alleged unlawful gains in an escrow account with a scheduled commercial bank in India.

Why claiming your PF money seems so difficultIt all starts with tiny mistakes. A spelling error in your name, a mismatch in your date of birth, or an old bank account number can be enough to freeze your claim.

entertainment.headline: KJo, Samantha, Parineeti lead celeb cheers as Sidharth-Kiara welcome baby girlActors Parineeti Chopra and Samantha Ruth Prabhu were amongst several celebrities who wished Bollywood couple Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani. The two announced the birth of their baby girl on Wednesday.

Nine hospitalised after stampede at Beyonce's Atlanta Cowboy Carter showSeveral Beyonce fans were injured in a stampede caused by a shouting passenger on a train following her concert in Atlanta. The incident occurred as the crowd reacted to the disturbance.

Nithya Menen had cow dung in nails while accepting National Award. Here's whyActor Nithya Menen recently opened up about the challenges she faced for her role in Dhanush's 'Idly Kadai'. She revealed that she had cow dung on her nails, which coincided with her accepting the National Film Award.

Ramayana aims to redefine world's perception of India: Producer Namit MalhotraProducer Namit Malhotra discussed his vision for Nitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana'. Malhotra said he wanted to centre Indian culture internationally, and decided to change Western perception of India.

Lewis Hamilton shares Jimin's Dior look, fans call it best crossover momentFormula 1 legend Lewis Hamilton shared a photo of BTS' Jimin dressed in an outfit from his Dior collection. The post sent fans into a frenzy online.

Kamal Haasan meets friend Rajinikanth ahead of Rajya Sabha oath taking ceremonyActor-politician Kamal Haasan met his longtime friend and actor Rajinikanth at the latter's Chennai home on Wednesday. The meeting happened days ahead of Haasan's oath-taking ceremony as a Rajya Sabha member.

Manisha Koirala gets honorary doctorate from University of Bradford, shares videoManisha Koirala was awarded an honorary doctorate by the University of Bradford. She also paid an emotional tribute to her late grandmother, whom she called her 'first teacher.'

Selena Gomez to marry Benny Blanco in September ceremony: ReportSinger Selena Gomez and her boyfriend Benny Blanco are reportedly planning a September wedding in Montecito, California. The wedding invitations have been sent out to their close friends and family.

Archana Puran Singh and family fall victim to online scam during Dubai tripArchana Puran Singh shared in her vlog that she and her family were scammed while booking indoor skydiving tickets in Dubai through a fake website. Despite paying a hefty amount, no reservation was found, leaving the family shocked and disappointed.

Actor Ram Pothineni debuts as lyricist with Andhra King TalukaTelugu actor Ram Pothineni is making his debut as a lyricist by penning the first single for his upcoming movie 'Andhra King Taluka'. With music by Anirudh Ravichander, the song will release on July 18, 2025.

Rajinikanth takes morning stroll in Chennai before Coolie release, pic goes viralSuperstar Rajinikanth was seen going on a casual morning walk in Chennai. A photo of the actor is now going viral on social media.

Sidharth-Kiara announce birth of baby girl in sweet post: Our world forever changedKiara Advani and Sidharth Malhotra became parents to a baby girl. On Wednesday morning, the couple shared the good news with the world, and expressed just how excited and happy they felt.

Mohit Suri backs Sandeep Reddy Vanga, says we make his films controversialFilmmaker Mohit Suri has come out in support of 'Animal' director Sandeep Reddy Vanga, calling himself a fan and defending his storytelling style. He said the controversies around Vanga's films are often audience-created.

Emotional Martin Scorsese shares joy of first Emmy nod with daughter FrancescaDirector Martin Scorsese received his first Emmy nomination for acting in the comedy series - 'The Studio'. His daughter Francesca Scorsese shared a heartfelt moment reflecting on the veteran's reaction to the new milestone.

They don't want to employ me: Director Mohit Suri on not returning for Aashiqui 3Director Mohit Suri shared he hasn't been approached to direct 'Aashiqui 3', despite expressing interest in reuniting with the original lead pair. He cited creative challenges and industry decisions as reasons behind his absence from the sequel.

Akshay Kumar and Twinkle Khanna enjoy cricket date at Lord's, shares photosAkshay Kumar and Twinkle Khanna made a stylish appearance at Lord's Cricket Ground during the India vs England Test match. Twinkle shared a few glimpses with her humorous take on the sport.

2025 Emmy nominations: Squid Game, Patrick Schwarzenegger among major snubsThe 77th Primetime Emmy nominations have been announced with popular shows like 'Squid Game' Season 2 and Renée Zellweger's TV-movie portrayal notably missing from the list. Fans expressed their disappointment as some major performances and shows were overlooked in this year's race.

Salman Khan's Bajrangi Bhaijaan 2 in works? Director confirms talks with actorDirector Kabir Khan has confirmed that he and Salman Khan are in talks for 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan 2', but they are waiting for the right story before moving forward. The director emphasised that the sequel would only be made to honour the original's legacy, not just for box office success.

Karnataka brings back Rs 200 cap for regional cinema in multiplexesKarnataka has re-introduced a Rs 200 cap on cinema ticket prices. This move could encourage audiences to visit theatres, potentially increasing attendance amidst past resistance from multiplexes.

general news.headline: Supreme Court allows Ashoka professor to post online, raps SIT over probe delayThe Supreme Court on Wednesday blasted the team probing the case against Ashoka University professor Ali Khan Mahmudabad in Operation Sindoor post case for delay in preparing the report. The bench also allowed the professor to continue posting online except on sub judice matters.

Rahul Gandhi writes to PM, makes key demand for J&K in Parliament sessionThe restoration of statehood to the Union Territory has been a long-pending demand of the opposition. However, the Pahalgam terror attack has come as a blow to the demand.

Not a child to understand what favour I need, Odisha professor 'told' studentThe internal complaint committee had advised the professor, accused of sexually harassing the student who died after setting herself on fire, to modify his behaviour and teaching methods.

Learnt from news I hit Fauja Singh: NRI arrested for legendary marathoner's deathDuring police questioning, NRI Amritpal Singh Dhillon revealed that he was returning from Mukerian after selling his phone when his vehicle struck 114-year-old athlete Fauja Singh near Bias Pind.

Why no cameras in cockpits? Air India crash sparks debate, demandThe fuel-switch report in the Air India Boeing 787 crash probe has sparked a demand for a cockpit video recorder. The NTSB of the US that probes air crashes has for years batted for one. If cockpit voice recorders are part of the black boxes of planes, what has kept cockpit video recorders, which would aid air crash investigations, from being installed?

If you're Prime Minister of India and...: Nato's warning over buying Russian oilMark Rutte warned the leaders of China, India, and Brazil that if they continued trading with Russia and buying its oil and gas, he would impose 100 per cent secondary sanctions.

Sunil Chhetri's first reaction over ISL's uncertain future: Very concerningIndian Super League: Sunil Chhetri urged calm and unity across Indian football as uncertainty looms over the ISL's future, expressing faith in the AIFF and FSDL to find a solution that protects the sport's growth and stability.
Kota: How India's coaching capital collapsedThe government is now intent on an education that promotes critical thinking rather than the rote learning coaching institutes foster

Samosa, Jalebi and a side of perspective: Not every treat needs a warning labelAs the Health Ministry opts for gentle 'oil and sugar' advisory boards over harsh labels, perhaps the real question isn't whether Indian treats are the problem but what we're conveniently ignoring on our globalised plates

Some Pak drones were found intact during Op Sindoor: Chief of Defence StaffAnil Chauhan, Chief of Defence Staff, said on Wednesday that some of the drones shot by Pakistan towards India during the four-day conflict after Operation Sindoor were found intact, implying that they may have not even functioned.

My daughter was killed: Father of Odisha student who self-immolated breaks downA 20-year-old Odisha student died after setting herself on fire on campus, accusing her professor of sexual harassment. Her father has called it murder, alleging she was forced to end her life.

After Sena MLA's slapgate, MVA leaders protest against 'chaddi-baniyan' governmentAfter Shiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad was caught on video thrashing a canteen contractor in a vest and towel, opposition leaders staged a 'chaddi-baniyan' protest inside the Maharashtra Assembly.

Sidharth-Kiara announce birth of baby girl in sweet post: Our world forever changedKiara Advani and Sidharth Malhotra became parents to a baby girl. On Wednesday morning, the couple shared the good news with the world, and expressed just how excited and happy they felt.

Akbar, Babur, Aurangzeb face historical scrutiny in NCERT's class 8 textbookNCERT Class 8 Social Science books will now teach about the atrocities during the Sultanate and Mughal periods, including the destruction of temples and the slaughter of masses. The new textbooks will offer a broader perspective on Maratha history.

What Trump said on trade talks with India as August 1 deadline loomsUS President Donald Trump updated on America's ongoing trade talks with India, showing hope and confidence, ahead of August 1, when his steep tariffs will come into effect.

Was Air India crash mechanical, accidental or…? FAQs answeredThe preliminary crash probe report has raised critical questions around how fuel supply to the engines got cut off. INDIA TODAY looks at the scenarios

Nine hospitalised after stampede at Beyonce's Atlanta Cowboy Carter showSeveral Beyonce fans were injured in a stampede caused by a shouting passenger on a train following her concert in Atlanta. The incident occurred as the crowd reacted to the disturbance.

The ball that bowled Siraj in Lord's Test: A freak delivery and pure bad luckEngland vs India: In a surreal final twist at Lord's, Mohammed Siraj was bowled by a delivery from Shoaib Bashir that spun off the pitch, the bat, and then the pitch again - a freak dismissal that defied cricketing logic. Siraj's gritty 30-ball stay ended when he was bowled as England went on to win a thriller by 22 runs.

Millions dead, Aadhaar still active: RTI finds only 1.15 crore cards deactivatedDespite over 83 lakh deaths recorded annually, UIDAI's cumbersome, certificate-dependent process has led to less than 10% of estimated deaths, resulting in Aadhaar deactivation, raising risks of misuse.

Tesla is finally in India. But can it go the distance?Tesla's India debut is a big milestone, but long-term success will depend on how well the company adapts to India's unique mix of pricing realities, policy expectations, and market dynamics.

Dasheri, Langra, Haribhanga and diplomacy: The many flavours of mangoBy sending 1,000 kg of Haribhanga mangoes to PM Modi, Bangladesh's interim leader Muhammad Yunus has sent a mixed signal amid strained India-Dhaka ties. From Pakistan gifting mangoes to China's Mao Zedong to Jawaharlal Nehru sharing saplings with Zhou Enlai, mango diplomacy has long played a subtle role in Asian geopolitics.
Tear gas, water cannon as protest rocks Odisha over student's self-immolationA massive protest took place outside Odisha Assembly on Wednesday morning over the female student's self-immolation.

Women aged over 24 banned from using UK gym during certain hours, post sparks debateA 36-year-old woman, in her post titled "To think this is unfair?", said she received an email from the gym notifying her of the revised schedule.

Maharashtra minister calls for Marathi in madrasas: All one gets there is a gunAmid a simmering language row in Maharashtra, Nitesh Rane emphasised that Marathi should be taught in madrasas so that 'real education happens there'.

Exclusive: How an Instagram reel got Shanaya Kapoor her first feature filmDirector Santosh Singh introduced Shanaya Kapoor in his latest romantic drama 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan'. In an exclusive interview with us, he revealed that the debutante wasn't the first choice for the role.

KJo, Samantha, Parineeti lead celeb cheers as Sidharth-Kiara welcome baby girlActors Parineeti Chopra and Samantha Ruth Prabhu were amongst several celebrities who wished Bollywood couple Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani. The two announced the birth of their baby girl on Wednesday.

sports.headline: Coach Sanath Jayasuriya dismisses pressure talk following 2nd T20I lossSri Lanka head coach Sanath Jayasuriya insisted on Tuesday that the team is not under pressure despite their embarrassing 83-run loss to Bangladesh in the second T20I.

Broad, Buttler believe chirpy Sundar, Nitish fuelled England's Lord's winEngland vs India: Stuart Broad and Jos Buttler felt Nitish Kumar Reddy and Washington Sundar's on-field antics on days three and four of the Lord's Test backfired, contributing to India's heartbreaking loss.

Sunil Chhetri's first reaction over ISL's uncertain future: Very concerningIndian Super League: Sunil Chhetri urged calm and unity across Indian football as uncertainty looms over the ISL's future, expressing faith in the AIFF and FSDL to find a solution that protects the sport's growth and stability.

England penalised two WTC points for slow overrate in Lord's Test against IndiaEngland have been docked two ICC World Test Championship points for a slow over rate in the Lord's Test against India. This penalty has pushed England down to third place, affecting their championship hopes.

Japan Open 2025: PV Sindhu crashes out in opening roundPV Sindhu's struggles continued as the two-time Olympic medallist crashed out in the first round of the Japan Open 2025 Super 750 tournament. In contrast, Lakshya Sen and the men's doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty registered commanding straight-game victories to advance to the second round.

Stuart MacGill breaks silence on life after cocaine case: Worried for my kidsFormer Australian spinner Stuart MacGill has opened up about the toll of his legal troubles on his life and family. He reveals how anxiety and isolation have affected him and his children while he tries to rebuild through cricket coaching.

Satwik-Chirag, Lakshya Sen cruise into second round of Japan Open 2025India's campaign at the Japan Open 2025 began on a high note, with Satwik-Chirag and Lakshya Sen cruising into the second round after impressive straight-game wins in their respective men's doubles and singles matches.

Andrew Flintoff drafts son Rocky as wilcard for Northern SuperchargersAndrew Flintoff's 17-year-old son Rocky has joined his dad's team, Northern Superchargers, as a wildcard pick for The Hundred 2025 — just days after scoring a century against India U-19 in a Youth ODI.

Crawley has learned nothing in 57 Tests: Boycott wants England to drop openerFormer England cricketer Geoffrey Boycott has called for Zak Crawley to be dropped after a series of disappointing performances. After a steady 65 in the first Test at Headingley, Crawley has struggled to maintain form, managing only 19, 0, 18, and 22 in his subsequent innings.

India could have been 3-0 up with a bit of luck in England series: Ravi ShastriFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri believes that, with a touch more luck, India might have taken a commanding 3-0 lead in the ongoing five-match Test series against England.

Karun Nair's dismissal was turning point in Lord's Test: Ajinkya RahaneAjinkya Rahane called Karun Nair's second-innings dismissal the turning point in the Lord's Test, as India's chase lost momentum following his LBW, opening the door for England to claw back into the match.

After a steady 65 in the first Test at Headingley, Crawley has struggled to maintain form, managing only 19, 0, 18, and 22 in his subsequent innings.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
